We have audited the financial statements of
SmartPractice Denmark ApS for the financial year 1
January - 31 December 2012, which comprise a
summary of significant accounting policies, income
statement, balance sheet and notes. The financial
statements have been prepared in accordance with the
Danish Financial Statements Act.
Ledelsens ansvar for Ã¥rsregnskabet Managementâs responsibility for the financial
statements
Ledelsen har ansvaret for udarbejdelsen af et Ã¥rsregnskab,
der giver et retvisende billede i overensstemmelse
med Ã¥rsregnskabsloven. Ledelsen har endvidere

nÃ¸dvendig for at udarbejde et Ã¥rsregnskab uden vÃ¦sentlig
fejlinformation, uanset om denne skyldes besvigelser

Management is responsible for the preparation of
financial statements that give a true and fair view in
accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
Further, management is responsible for such internal
control as it determines is necessary to enable the
preparation of financial statements that are free from
material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
Revisors ansvar Auditor's responsibility
Vores ansvar er at udtrykke en konklusion om Ã¥rsregnskabet
pÃ¥ grundlag af vores revision. Vi har udfÃ¸rt revisionen
i overensstemmelse med internationale standarder
om revision og yderligere krav ifÃ¸lge dansk revisorlovgivning.
Dette krÃ¦ver, at vi overholder etiske krav
samt planlÃ¦gger og udfÃ¸rer revisionen for at opnÃ¥ hÃ¸j
grad af sikkerhed for, om Ã¥rsregnskabet er uden vÃ¦sentlig
fejlinformation.
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial statements based on our audit. We conducted
our audit in accordance with international standards on
auditing and additional requirements according to
Danish audit regulations. This requires that we comply
with ethical requirements and plan and perform the
audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free from material
misstatement.
En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger
for at opnÃ¥ revisionsbevis for belÃ¸b og oplysninger i Ã¥rsregnskabet.
De valgte revisionshandlinger afhÃ¦nger af
revisors vurdering, herunder en vurdering af risici for
vÃ¦sentlig fejlinformation i Ã¥rsregnskabet, uanset om
denne skyldes besvigelser eller fejl. Ved risikovurderingen
overvejer revisor intern kontrol, der er relevant for
virksomhedens udarbejdelse af et Ã¥rsregnskab, der giver
et retvisende billede. FormÃ¥let hermed er at udforme
revisionshandlinger, der er passende efter omstÃ¦ndighederne,
men ikke at udtrykke en konklusion om effektiviteten
af virksomhedens interne kontrol. En revision
omfatter endvidere en vurdering af, om ledelsens
valg af regnskabspraksis er passende, om ledelsens
regnskabsmÃ¦ssige skÃ¸n er rimelige samt den samlede
prÃ¦sentation af Ã¥rsregnskabet.
An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.
Det er vores opfattelse, at det opnÃ¥ede revisionsbevis
er tilstrÃ¦kkeligt og egnet som grundlag for vores konklusion.
We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is
sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our
audit opinion.
Revisionen har ikke givet anledning til forbehold. Our audit has not resulted in any qualification.

Ã¥rsregnskabsloven.
In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and
fair view of the companyâs financial position at 31
December 2012 and of the results of its operations for
the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2012 in
accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.

Acquired intangible assets are tested for impairment

Usikkerhed ved indregning og mÃ¥ling
Recognition and measurement uncertainties
Der foreligger usikkerhed om vÃ¦rdien af de indregnede immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt vÃ¦rdien af det
indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen af de immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver beror
pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at generere positive pengestrÃ¸mme i fremtiden. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen
af det udskudte skatteaktiv beror pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at opnÃ¥ en positiv indtjening i fremtiden. Selskabets
ledelse har foretaget en nedskrivningstest af de indregnede immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt vÃ¦rdien
af det indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Nedskrivningstesten er baseret pÃ¥ ledelsens forventninger til selskabets
indtjening. Ledelsens forventer et overskud fÃ¸r skat i 2013 pÃ¥ ca. kr. 7,4 mio og ogsÃ¥ overskud i Ã¥rene
efter 2013. PÃ¥ baggrund af disse forventninger til pengestrÃ¸mme fra indtjeningen har ledelsen vurderet, at
der ikke er behov for nedskrivning og selskabets ledelse har vurderet at de immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt
det udskudte skatteaktiv kan indregnes i regnskabet til de bogfÃ¸rte vÃ¦rdier.
There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

Virksomhedens vÃ¦sentligste aktiviteter
The company's primary activities
SmartPractice Denmark ApS' aktiviteter er koncentreret om forskning, udvikling og produktion af selskabets
patenterede testsystem TRUE Testâ¢ til in vivo diagnose af kontaktallergi. SmartPractice Denmark ApS
opererer internationalt via licenstagere/distributÃ¸rer, der er ansvarlige for salg og markedsfÃ¸ring af TRUE
Testâ¢ primÃ¦rt i Europa og Nordamerika.
SmartPractice Denmark ApS's activities are centred around research, development and production of the company's patented test
system, TRUE Testâ¢, for in vivo diagnosis of contact allergy. SmartPractice ApS operates internationally through licensees/-
distributors, who are responsible for the sale and marketing of TRUE Testâ¢, primarily in Europe and North America.

We have audited the financial statements of
SmartPractice Denmark ApS for the financial year 1
January - 31 December 2012, which comprise a
summary of significant accounting policies, income
statement, balance sheet and notes. The financial
statements have been prepared in accordance with the
Danish Financial Statements Act.

Ledelsen har ansvaret for udarbejdelsen af et Ã¥rsregnskab,

Management is responsible for the preparation of
financial statements that give a true and fair view in
accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
Further, management is responsible for such internal
control as it determines is necessary to enable the
preparation of financial statements that are free from
material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
Revisors ansvar Auditor's responsibility
Vores ansvar er at udtrykke en konklusion om Ã¥rsregnskabet

fejlinformation.
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial statements based on our audit. We conducted
our audit in accordance with international standards on
auditing and additional requirements according to
Danish audit regulations. This requires that we comply
with ethical requirements and plan and perform the
audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free from material
misstatement.
En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger
for at opnÃ¥ revisionsbevis for belÃ¸b og oplysninger i Ã¥rsregnskabet.
De valgte revisionshandlinger afhÃ¦nger af
revisors vurdering, herunder en vurdering af risici for
vÃ¦sentlig fejlinformation i Ã¥rsregnskabet, uanset om
denne skyldes besvigelser eller fejl. Ved risikovurderingen
overvejer revisor intern kontrol, der er relevant for

et retvisende billede. FormÃ¥let hermed er at udforme

valg af regnskabspraksis er passende, om ledelsens
regnskabsmÃ¦ssige skÃ¸n er rimelige samt den samlede
prÃ¦sentation af Ã¥rsregnskabet.
An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.
Det er vores opfattelse, at det opnÃ¥ede revisionsbevis
er tilstrÃ¦kkeligt og egnet som grundlag for vores konklusion.
We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is
sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our
audit opinion.
Revisionen har ikke givet anledning til forbehold. Our audit has not resulted in any qualification.

indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen af de immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver beror
pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at generere positive pengestrÃ¸mme i fremtiden. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen

af det indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Nedskrivningstesten er baseret pÃ¥ ledelsens forventninger til selskabets
indtjening. Ledelsens forventer et overskud fÃ¸r skat i 2013 pÃ¥ ca. kr. 7,4 mio og ogsÃ¥ overskud i Ã¥rene
efter 2013. PÃ¥ baggrund af disse forventninger til pengestrÃ¸mme fra indtjeningen har ledelsen vurderet, at

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the

En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

af det udskudte skatteaktiv beror pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at opnÃ¥ en positiv indtjening i fremtiden. Selskabets
ledelse har foretaget en nedskrivningstest af de indregnede immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt vÃ¦rdien

indtjening. Ledelsens forventer et overskud fÃ¸r skat i 2013 pÃ¥ ca. kr. 7,4 mio og ogsÃ¥ overskud i Ã¥rene

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

Acquired intangible assets are tested for impairment

amount.

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of

accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

We have audited the financial statements of

January - 31 December 2012, which comprise a
summary of significant accounting policies, income

statements have been prepared in accordance with the

Management is responsible for the preparation of

Further, management is responsible for such internal
control as it determines is necessary to enable the
preparation of financial statements that are free from
material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.

Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial statements based on our audit. We conducted
our audit in accordance with international standards on
auditing and additional requirements according to
Danish audit regulations. This requires that we comply
with ethical requirements and plan and perform the
audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free from material

En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger
for at opnÃ¥ revisionsbevis for belÃ¸b og oplysninger i Ã¥rsregnskabet.
De valgte revisionshandlinger afhÃ¦nger af

denne skyldes besvigelser eller fejl. Ved risikovurderingen

et retvisende billede. FormÃ¥let hermed er at udforme

men ikke at udtrykke en konklusion om effektiviteten

regnskabsmÃ¦ssige skÃ¸n er rimelige samt den samlede

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

We have audited the financial statements of
SmartPractice Denmark ApS for the financial year 1
January - 31 December 2012, which comprise a
summary of significant accounting policies, income
statement, balance sheet and notes. The financial
statements have been prepared in accordance with the
Danish Financial Statements Act.
Ledelsens ansvar for Ã¥rsregnskabet Managementâs responsibility for the financial

Ledelsen har ansvaret for udarbejdelsen af et Ã¥rsregnskab,

Management is responsible for the preparation of
financial statements that give a true and fair view in
accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
Further, management is responsible for such internal
control as it determines is necessary to enable the
preparation of financial statements that are free from
material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
Revisors ansvar Auditor's responsibility
Vores ansvar er at udtrykke en konklusion om Ã¥rsregnskabet
pÃ¥ grundlag af vores revision. Vi har udfÃ¸rt revisionen

grad af sikkerhed for, om Ã¥rsregnskabet er uden vÃ¦sentlig
fejlinformation.
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial statements based on our audit. We conducted
our audit in accordance with international standards on
auditing and additional requirements according to
Danish audit regulations. This requires that we comply
with ethical requirements and plan and perform the
audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free from material
misstatement.
En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger
for at opnÃ¥ revisionsbevis for belÃ¸b og oplysninger i Ã¥rsregnskabet.
De valgte revisionshandlinger afhÃ¦nger af
revisors vurdering, herunder en vurdering af risici for
vÃ¦sentlig fejlinformation i Ã¥rsregnskabet, uanset om
denne skyldes besvigelser eller fejl. Ved risikovurderingen
overvejer revisor intern kontrol, der er relevant for

et retvisende billede. FormÃ¥let hermed er at udforme

men ikke at udtrykke en konklusion om effektiviteten

omfatter endvidere en vurdering af, om ledelsens
valg af regnskabspraksis er passende, om ledelsens
regnskabsmÃ¦ssige skÃ¸n er rimelige samt den samlede
prÃ¦sentation af Ã¥rsregnskabet.
An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.
Det er vores opfattelse, at det opnÃ¥ede revisionsbevis
er tilstrÃ¦kkeligt og egnet som grundlag for vores konklusion.
We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is
sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our
audit opinion.
Revisionen har ikke givet anledning til forbehold. Our audit has not resulted in any qualification.

In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

distributors, who are responsible for the sale and marketing of TRUE Testâ¢, primarily in Europe and North America.

We have audited the financial statements of
SmartPractice Denmark ApS for the financial year 1
January - 31 December 2012, which comprise a
summary of significant accounting policies, income
statement, balance sheet and notes. The financial
statements have been prepared in accordance with the
Danish Financial Statements Act.
Ledelsens ansvar for Ã¥rsregnskabet Managementâs responsibility for the financial
statements
Ledelsen har ansvaret for udarbejdelsen af et Ã¥rsregnskab,

Management is responsible for the preparation of
financial statements that give a true and fair view in
accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
Further, management is responsible for such internal
control as it determines is necessary to enable the
preparation of financial statements that are free from
material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
Revisors ansvar Auditor's responsibility
Vores ansvar er at udtrykke en konklusion om Ã¥rsregnskabet
pÃ¥ grundlag af vores revision. Vi har udfÃ¸rt revisionen

samt planlÃ¦gger og udfÃ¸rer revisionen for at opnÃ¥ hÃ¸j
grad af sikkerhed for, om Ã¥rsregnskabet er uden vÃ¦sentlig
fejlinformation.
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial statements based on our audit. We conducted
our audit in accordance with international standards on
auditing and additional requirements according to
Danish audit regulations. This requires that we comply
with ethical requirements and plan and perform the
audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free from material
misstatement.
En revision omfatter udfÃ¸relse af revisionshandlinger
for at opnÃ¥ revisionsbevis for belÃ¸b og oplysninger i Ã¥rsregnskabet.
De valgte revisionshandlinger afhÃ¦nger af
revisors vurdering, herunder en vurdering af risici for
vÃ¦sentlig fejlinformation i Ã¥rsregnskabet, uanset om
denne skyldes besvigelser eller fejl. Ved risikovurderingen
overvejer revisor intern kontrol, der er relevant for
virksomhedens udarbejdelse af et Ã¥rsregnskab, der giver
et retvisende billede. FormÃ¥let hermed er at udforme
revisionshandlinger, der er passende efter omstÃ¦ndighederne,
men ikke at udtrykke en konklusion om effektiviteten

omfatter endvidere en vurdering af, om ledelsens
valg af regnskabspraksis er passende, om ledelsens
regnskabsmÃ¦ssige skÃ¸n er rimelige samt den samlede
prÃ¦sentation af Ã¥rsregnskabet.
An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.
Det er vores opfattelse, at det opnÃ¥ede revisionsbevis
er tilstrÃ¦kkeligt og egnet som grundlag for vores konklusion.
We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is
sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our
audit opinion.
Revisionen har ikke givet anledning til forbehold. Our audit has not resulted in any qualification.

management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit
evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the
financial statements. The procedures selected depend
on the auditorâs judgement, including an assessment of
the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal
control relevant to the entityâs preparation of financial
statements that give a true and fair view. The purpose is
to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not to express an opinion on the
effectiveness of the entityâs internal control. An audit
also includes evaluating the appropriateness of
accounting policies used, the reasonableness of
accounting estimates made by management as well as
the overall presentation of the financial statements.

Sales effected on long-term interest-free credit terms

Tax for the year includes current tax on the year's

Aktuelle skatteforpligtelser indregnes i balancen som

Current tax charges are recognised in the balance sheet
at the estimated tax charge in respect of the expected
taxable income for the year, adjusted for tax on prior
years' taxable income and tax paid on account.
HensÃ¦ttelse til udskudt skat beregnes med 25% af alle
midlertidige forskelle mellem regnskabsmÃ¦ssige og
skattemÃ¦ssige vÃ¦rdier bortset fra midlertidige forskelle,

Provisions for deferred tax are calculated at 25% of all
temporary differences between carrying amounts and
tax values, with the exception of temporary differences
occurring at the time of acquisition of assets and
liabilities neither affecting the results of operations nor
the taxable income, and temporary differences on nonamortisable
goodwill.
Udskudte skatteaktiver indregnes med den vÃ¦rdi, som
de forventes at blive udnyttet med, enten ved udligning
i skat af fremtidig indtjening eller ved modregning i udskudte
skatteforpligtelser.
Deferred tax assets are recognised at the value at which
they are expected to be utilised, either through
elimination against tax on future earnings or a set-off
against deferred tax liabilities.

Usikkerhed ved indregning og mÃ¥ling
Recognition and measurement uncertainties
Der foreligger usikkerhed om vÃ¦rdien af de indregnede immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt vÃ¦rdien af det
indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen af de immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver beror
pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at generere positive pengestrÃ¸mme i fremtiden. Usikkerheden ved vÃ¦rdiansÃ¦ttelsen
af det udskudte skatteaktiv beror pÃ¥ selskabets evne til at opnÃ¥ en positiv indtjening i fremtiden. Selskabets
ledelse har foretaget en nedskrivningstest af de indregnede immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt vÃ¦rdien
af det indregnede udskudte skatteaktiv. Nedskrivningstesten er baseret pÃ¥ ledelsens forventninger til selskabets
indtjening. Ledelsens forventer et overskud fÃ¸r skat i 2013 pÃ¥ ca. kr. 7,4 mio og ogsÃ¥ overskud i Ã¥rene
efter 2013. PÃ¥ baggrund af disse forventninger til pengestrÃ¸mme fra indtjeningen har ledelsen vurderet, at
der ikke er behov for nedskrivning og selskabets ledelse har vurderet at de immaterielle anlÃ¦gsaktiver samt
det udskudte skatteaktiv kan indregnes i regnskabet til de bogfÃ¸rte vÃ¦rdier.
There is some uncertainty as to the measurement of intangible assets and the deferred tax asset. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of intangible assets relates to the company's ability to generate positive future cash flows. The uncertainty as to the
measurement of the deferred tax asset relates to the company's ability to generate positive future earnings. The company's
management has tested the intangible assets and the deferred tax asset for impairment based on earnings projections. Management
expects a profit of around DKK 7.4 million in 2013 and a profit for the coming years as well. Against the background of these cash flow
forecasts, management has not identified any indication of impairment and finds the measurement of the intangible assets and the
deferred tax asset reasonable.

Virksomhedens vÃ¦sentligste aktiviteter
The company's primary activities
SmartPractice Denmark ApS' aktiviteter er koncentreret om forskning, udvikling og produktion af selskabets
patenterede testsystem TRUE Testâ¢ til in vivo diagnose af kontaktallergi. SmartPractice Denmark ApS
opererer internationalt via licenstagere/distributÃ¸rer, der er ansvarlige for salg og markedsfÃ¸ring af TRUE
Testâ¢ primÃ¦rt i Europa og Nordamerika.
SmartPractice Denmark ApS's activities are centred around research, development and production of the company's patented test
system, TRUE Testâ¢, for in vivo diagnosis of contact allergy. SmartPractice ApS operates internationally through licensees/-
distributors, who are responsible for the sale and marketing of TRUE Testâ¢, primarily in Europe and North America.
